citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee was administering an expired medication on their animals. During the inspection, a bottle of Pyrantel
Pamoate was found with an expiration date of 08/04/2023. The licensee stated that they have been using this medication
on some of the puppies and adult dogs. The use of expired drugs may have reduced effectiveness or cause harmful
effects to the animals. The licensee must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Correct by ensuring that all
animals receive adequate veterinary care including the use of medications that have not expired.

The facility did not keep complete medical records for an animal for the required length of time. Records indicate that an
Adult female Burnese Mountain Dog (#9255) was prescribed Carprofen and Cephalexin on 02/05/2024. The animal left
the facility less than a year ago and the licensee states they did not keep the medical records for those treatments. Failure
to maintain medical records for animals does not allow APHIS officials to determine adequacy of veterinary care. Correct
by ensuring that the medical records for dogs are kept and maintained for at least 1 year after the dog is euthanized or
disposed of and for any period in excess of 1 year as necessary to comply with any applicable Federal, State, or local law.
Correct by 15-FEB-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee was administering an expired medication on their animals. During the inspection, a bottle of Pyrantel 
Pamoate was found with an expiration date of 08/04/2023. The licensee stated that they have been using this medication 
on some of the puppies and adult dogs. The use of expired drugs may have reduced effectiveness or cause harmful 
effects to the animals. The licensee must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the 
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Correct by ensuring that all 
animals receive adequate veterinary care including the use of medications that have not expired. 
3.13(c)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility did not keep complete medical records for an animal for the required length of time. Records indicate that an 
Adult female Burnese Mountain Dog (#9255) was prescribed Carprofen and Cephalexin on 02/05/2024. The animal left 
the facility less than a year ago and the licensee states they did not keep the medical records for those treatments. Failure 
to maintain medical records for animals does not allow APHIS officials to determine adequacy of veterinary care. Correct 
by ensuring that the medical records for dogs are kept and maintained for at least 1 year after the dog is euthanized or 
disposed of and for any period in excess of 1 year as necessary to comply with any applicable Federal, State, or local law. 
Correct by 15-FEB-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
